parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> System

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Set variable to given value in the variable space of given FSM.
<br>The FSM handle is the number returned by the [[execFSM]] command.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> handle '''setFSMVariable''' [name, value]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> handle: [[Number]] - FSM handle

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> [name,value]: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> name: [[String]] - name of the FSM variable

</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> value: [[Anything]] - new value of the FSM variable

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_handle = [[execFSM]] "test.fsm";
_handle [[setFSMVariable]] ["_foo", 23];
</code>
sets variable <tt>_foo</tt> in the FSM to 23

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[FSM]], [[commandFSM]], [[completedFSM]], [[doFSM]], [[execFSM]], [[getFSMVariable]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on March 23, 2014 - 00:53</dd>
<dt class="note">'''[[User:Master85|Master85]] ([[User talk:Master85|talk]])'''<dd class="note">If the variable is not yet defined within the FSM it will be created.
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
